title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 April 2014 - XWiki
content:
has quit 00:15  has joined #xwiki 00:19  has quit 00:21  has joined #xwiki 00:27  has quit 03:07  has quit 03:40  has quit 04:18  has quit 04:30  has joined #xwiki 06:03  has quit 06:39  has joined #xwiki 07:19  has joined #xwiki 07:38  has quit 07:48  has joined #xwiki 08:13  has quit 08:16  has quit 08:31  has joined #xwiki 08:35  has joined #xwiki 08:42  has joined #xwiki 08:48  has joined #xwiki 08:50  has joined #xwiki 08:51  has quit 08:51  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 08:59  has quit 09:07  has joined #xwiki 09:14  has joined #xwiki 09:20  has joined #xwiki 09:24  has joined #xwiki 09:25  has joined #xwiki 09:25  has quit 09:32  has joined #xwiki 09:35  has quit 09:52  has joined #xwiki 10:03  has joined #xwiki 10:06  Hello :) 10:06  hi 10:06  interesting: http://blogs.atlassian.com/2013/04/git-flow-comes-to-java/ 10:07  ;D 10:08  Hmm, do you know if there is a way to get full path to a user (like: "xwiki:XWiki.Admin") from $xwiki.getUser()? I tried a few things but can only get "XWiki.Admin". 10:11  spu7nic: what version of XWiki ? In recent version you have $xwiki.getUserReference() which gived you a complete DocumentReference 10:11  looks like I forgot to indicate the @since in the javadoc 10:12  5.4.1 10:12  actually I'm not the one who added it :) 10:12  in 5.4.1 you should have it 10:13  then you can use model script service to serialize it as you want (by default you will get a complete reference with toString() I think) 10:13  see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Model+Module#HScriptServiceAPI 10:14  this API exist since 3.2 actually, i'm mising with something else I added recently 10:15  tmortagne: Hmmm, $xwiki.getUserReference() called from velocity does not return anything. My workaround was just prefixing the string with "xwiki:", but that seemed a little odd ^\_^ 10:15  not $xwiki 10:15  $xcontext 10:16  ahhh :) great thx 10:16  di not know you could get the context user from $xwiki acually 10:16  does not sounds like the right place 10:16  You get the wrapper object :) 10:17  yea 10:17  but still 10:17  Hmmm, the class docs at http://maven.xwiki.org/site/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core/apidocs/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Context.html seem to be a little out-dated :) 10:17  don't use http://maven.xwiki.org/site 10:17  :) 10:17  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation?xpage=embed is better 10:18  Google pointed me there 10:18  we should clean that old maven site generation try 10:18  looking at it 10:18  tmortagne: thx again :) 10:19  bookmarked ^\_° 10:19  spu7nic: you're welcome 10:51  How do i get rid of a paragraph with a br at the beginning of #xwikicontent? I tried removing some blank lines, but then I get a "When using the HTML macro inline, you can only use inline HTML content. Block HTML content (such as tables) cannot be displayed" error :/ 10:52  spu7nic: what's not clear in this message? (trying to find out how to improve it if it's not clear) 10:52  spu7nic: put wiki="false" in your {{velocity}} macro to debug what your script actually generate so see where exactly this
come from 10:53  (velocity or other script macro) 10:53  velocity 10:54  tmortagne: I know where the paragraph comes from - but I can't add an html macro with clean="true" at the beginning of my velocity block :( 10:55  and clean="false" removes all the panels 10:57  spu7nic: the issue does not come from your html macro 10:57  if it's inline when remove the empty line before it then it means there is something before that html macro 10:58  and you should see it quickly with wiki="false" 10:58  Indeed, another velocity block with output="none" :) 10:59  if you have just one empty line between your velocity output=false and the following one there is no reason you get a
10:59  you probably have too much of those 11:02  http://pastebin.com/TtmmJLcm 11:03  spu7nic: if the velocity macro that contain your html macro is not standalone it's content is not standalone either 11:03  put an empty line between the two first velocity macros 11:04  in general unless you specifically want a macro to be in a

always isolate macros 11:04  Ahhh 11:04  That was the only thing I didn't try :/ 11:04  It never even came to my mind that there had to be a newline between two velocity blocks ^\_° 11:05  the logic is that when you visually have two element in the same logical paragraph then they become inline element in the same paragraph, whatever element it is 11:05  s/element/elements/ 11:05  tmortagne: thx ;) 11:06  My thought was: output="none" means, there it will be no conent 11:06  content 11:06  And I can ignore the first block 11:06  and there will be no content in html, but paragraphs are calculated before executing the macros 11:07  and macros are black box 11:07  tmortagne: I should definitely send you a bottle of wine some day :D 11:08  spu7nic: please don't bother, I don't drink wine (yea OK I'm French and don't drink wine but I do eat a lot of cheese so it's Ok ;)) 11:28  has joined #xwiki 12:44  has joined #xwiki 13:15  has quit 13:34  what would be the best way to redirect a user to a specific page after a page has been saved with save & view? 13:34  has quit 13:35  spu7nic: how does the user access to that edit mode ? you can put ?xredirect=urltoredirectto in the edit URL and the redirect will be applied after the save 13:36  tmortagne: perfect - that will work :) 13:38  that xredirect thing works with most actions 13:38  does xredirect allow Spacename.Pagename or do you have to specify the escaped URL? 13:39  it's a URL 13:39  ah, thx :) 13:39  but indeed supporting any reference would be nice 13:39  +1 :) 13:39  note that I don't thing the URL need to be complete 13:39  I think you can put relative URL 13:40  s/thing/think/ 13:40  since redirect to relative URL works 13:40  (not at HTTP level but at app server level) 13:46  has quit 13:51  has joined #xwiki 13:53  has quit 13:55  has joined #xwiki 13:56  has quit 13:57  has joined #xwiki 14:09  has quit 14:10  has joined #xwiki 14:43  has quit 14:45  has joined #xwiki 14:59  has quit 15:30  has quit 15:30  has joined #xwiki 15:30  has quit 15:31  has joined #xwiki 15:42  has joined #xwiki 15:46  has quit 15:48  has joined #xwiki 15:56  has quit 15:56  has joined #xwiki 15:58  has joined #xwiki 16:09  has joined #xwiki 16:10  has quit 16:10  is now known as 16:23  has quit 16:27  has quit 16:29  has joined #xwiki 16:44  has left #xwiki 16:55  has joined #xwiki 17:28  has quit 17:31  has joined #xwiki 17:50  has quit 18:20  has quit 18:22  has quit 18:24  has quit 18:24  has quit 18:35  has quit 19:00  has quit 19:03  has joined #xwiki 19:27  has quit 19:37  has quit 19:42  has joined #xwiki 20:09  has quit 20:15  has joined #xwiki 20:18  has quit 20:18  has joined #xwiki 20:19  has quit 20:44  has joined #xwiki 20:46  has quit 20:49  has joined #xwiki 21:10  has joined #xwiki
